item.title: Canto Primeiro
item.description: The first section of "Os Lusiadas" pays tribute to famous poets and a young king. It starts off similarly to other epic tales, showing Greek gods keeping tabs on Vasco da Gama's journey. Venus supports the Portuguese explorers, while Bacchus opposes them, viewing them as intruders in his eastern domain. The story jumps into the middle of da Gama's trip, just after passing the Cape of Good Hope. Bacchus, disguised as a Moor, tries to get local Muslims to attack da Gama and his crew.
